neutral.body:

The Governor emphasized the importance of their participation in the legislative process and urged them to return to the Capitol to fulfill their duties.
Abbott stated that failure to return and vote on the redistricting map may result in potential consequences, including expulsion from office. This move comes as tensions rise over the contentious issue of redrawing electoral boundaries in Texas.
The Governor's warning serves as a reminder of the responsibilities that elected officials hold in representing their constituents and making crucial decisions on behalf of the state.
